item.title: 杰富瑞在推进扩张中迁至更大的新加坡办事处
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，杰富瑞金融集团公司（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Jefferies Financial Group Inc. is set to move to a larger office space in Singapore, according to people familiar with the matter, in a further signal of the Wall Street firm’s expansion drive in Asia.】

item.title: 关税施压，中国服务业增速回升
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，中国 3 月份的服务业活动有所回升，在美国额外关税给世界第二大经济体带来压力之前，这是一个值得欢迎的迹象。【原文：China’s service activity picked up in March, according to a private survey, a welcome sign before extra US tariffs pile pressure on the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.description:
在本周的澳大利亚播客中：丽贝卡-琼斯（Rebecca Jones）与政府记者本-韦斯特科特（Ben Westcott）畅谈竞选活动中的期待

item.title: 美国征收新关税，香港中国股市下跌
item.description: 在美国对中国几乎所有产品加征有史以来最大规模的关税后，中国股市下滑，人民币走软。【原文：Chinese stocks slid and the yuan weakened after the US hit the world’s No. 2 economy with the biggest-ever tariff hike on almost all of the nation’s products.】

item.title: 英国央行称美国关税强于预期，警告将出现波动
item.description: 韩国央行誓言将密切关注市场波动，并在必要时采取行动，称美国总统唐纳德-特朗普最新宣布的关税措施比市场预期的更为强硬。【原文：The Bank of Korea vowed to keep a close watch on market volatility and take action as needed, describing the latest tariffs announced by President Donald Trump as stronger than what markets were expecting.】

item.title: 美国征收新关税后，中国维持对人民币的支持
item.description: 在美国对世界第二大经济体加征有史以来最大规模的关税之后，中国央行保持了对本国货币的支持。【原文：China’s central bank retained support for its currency after the US hit the world’s No. 2 economy with the biggest-ever tariff hike.】

item.title: 关税影响日本央行加息前景，日本银行股大跌
item.description: 日本银行业股价暴跌超过 7%，创 8 月份以来最大跌幅，原因是人们担心美国征收比预期更为严厉的关税会对日本经济造成影响，这助长了对日本央行可能暂停加息的押注。【原文：A measure of Japanese bank shares plunged more than 7%, the most since August, as worries about the impact of harsher-than-expected US tariffs on Japan’s economy fueled bets the central bank may pause rate hikes.】

item.title: 特朗普关税影响情绪，欧洲股票期货下跌
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普公布了对美国全球贸易伙伴征收新关税的计划，其中包括对欧盟征收 20% 的关税，此后欧洲股市将下跌。【原文：European stocks were set to drop after US President Donald Trump unveiled his plans for new tariffs on US trading partners worldwide, including a rate of 20% for the European Union.】

item.title: 东南亚货币和股票高度受美国关税影响
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对亚洲新兴国家加征部分最大规模关税后，东南亚货币开盘走低，该地区的股票也将下跌。【原文：Southeast Asian currencies opened lower and the region’s stocks look set to drop after Asian emerging nations were given some of the biggest tariff increases by US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 特朗普向 "朋友 "莫迪施压，对印度征收 26% 关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对印度征收了美国主要贸易伙伴中最高的一些关税，并表示他与印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪良好的个人关系并没有影响他的决定。【原文：President Donald Trump slapped India with some of the highest tariff rates imposed on any major US trading partner, saying his good personal ties with Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not affect his decision.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行认为银行能够抵御美国关税的 "寒蝉效应
item.description: 储备银行在一份半年度报告中称，美国的贸易政策和各国对这些政策的反应可能会对全球商业投资和家庭支出产生 "寒蝉效应"，不过澳大利亚的金融体系完全有能力抵御这样的风暴。【原文：US trade policies and nations’ responses to them could have a “chilling effect” on global business investment and household spending, though Australia’s financial system is well placed to weather such a storm, the Reserve Bank said in a half-yearly review.】

item.title: 亿万富翁贾里德-艾萨克曼将出席参议院美国国家航空航天局听证会
item.description: 4月9日，美国国会议员将就唐纳德-特朗普总统提名的美国国家航空航天局（NASA）负责人举行期待已久的听证会，为亿万富翁、金融科技企业家贾里德-艾萨克曼（Jared Isaacman）执掌航天局铺平道路。【原文：Lawmakers will hold a long-awaited hearing for President Donald Trump’s nomination to run NASA on April 9, paving the way for billionaire fintech entrepreneur Jared Isaacman to take the helm of the space agency.】

item.title: 加拿大和墨西哥作为特朗普的早期目标，躲过了新关税炮火的最坏影响
item.description: 加拿大和墨西哥躲过了唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布的新一轮关税，这让这两个美国最大贸易伙伴的企业和投资者松了一口气。【原文：Canada and Mexico escaped President Donald Trump’s new round of tariff announcements, a relief for businesses and investors in the two biggest US trading partners.】

item.title: 韩国召开紧急会议应对美国关税
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布对贸易伙伴征收包括对首尔征收更高关税在内的全面关税后，韩国临时领导人韩德洙敦促官员们积极与美国进行谈判。【原文：South Korea’s interim leader Han Duck-soo urged officials to actively engage in negotiations with the US after President Donald Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs on trading partners that included higher duties for Seoul.】

item.title: 新加坡元处于扩大亚洲领先地位的有利位置
item.description: 至少根据彭博社对新元与其他市场关系的分析，新元在第一季度的优异表现可能会在短期内延续。【原文：The Singapore dollar’s outperformance in the first quarter can extend over the near-term, at least according to a Bloomberg analysis of its relationship with other markets.】

item.title: 中国和印度阻碍了全球煤电的转移：GEM
item.description: 据《全球能源观察》的一份新报告称，中国和印度的煤电热潮正在破坏全球从污染严重的电力来源向煤电的转变。【原文：China and India’s coal-power boom is undermining the world’s shift from the heavily polluting source of electricity, according to a new report from Global Energy Monitor.】

item.title: 特朗普关税风险加剧，股市下跌，债券跳涨：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普公布了比预期更为激进的对等关税，引发了对通胀和经济增长的担忧，投资者急于寻求安全，股市暴跌，避险资产反弹。【原文：Stocks plunged and haven assets rallied as investors rushed for safety after US President Donald Trump unveiled reciprocal tariffs that were more aggressive than expected, sparking concerns over inflation and growth.】

item.title: 越南的魅力攻势未能抵挡特朗普 46%的关税
item.description: 越南在特朗普政府的魅力攻势下削减了进口关税，并誓言购买更多美国大宗产品以保护其依赖贸易的经济，但越南未能避免白宫宣布的最大关税之一。【原文：Vietnam, which deployed a Trump administration charm offensive by slashing levies on imports and vowing to buy more big-ticket US products to protect its trade-reliant economy, failed to avert one of the largest tariffs announced by the White House.】

item.title: 特朗普将对华关税提高至至少 54%，经济遭受重创
item.description: 美国对几乎所有中国产品加征了有史以来最大规模的关税，使征税总额至少达到 54%，此举可能会削弱中国对世界最大经济体的出货量。【原文：The US has hit China with the biggest-ever tariff hike on almost all Chinese products, bringing total levies to at least 54%, a move that could decimate Chinese shipments to the world’s largest economy.】

item.title: 交易员解读特朗普关税狂潮，黄金创历史新高
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普公布了其全面的 "对等 "关税政策，对进口商品征收最低 10%的关税，引发了人们对可能引发全球经济放缓的担忧，黄金因此创下了每盎司近 3160 美元的新纪录。【原文：Gold hit a new record of nearly $3,160 an ounce after President Donald Trump unveiled his sweeping “reciprocal” tariffs, imposing a minimum levy of 10% on imports and stoking fears it may trigger a global economic slowdown.】

item.title: 特朗普围绕美国经济的关税墙意外偏高
item.description: 大于预期。如果要从美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周三宣布的关税声明中得到一个简单的启示，那就是："这是个大问题。【原文：Bigger than expected. If there is one simple takeaway from US President Donald Trump’s tariff announcement on Wednesday, that is it.】

item.title: 关税让美联储陷入困境，引发对经济增长和物价的担忧
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三宣布了一系列激进的关税措施，这将使美联储努力抑制通胀和避免经济下滑的工作变得更加复杂，可能会使官员们处于观望状态。【原文：An aggressive suite of tariffs announced Wednesday by President Donald Trump will significantly complicate the Federal Reserve’s job as it struggles to quash inflation and avoid an economic downturn, likely keeping officials in wait-and-see mode.】

item.title: 智囊团称：英国生活水平面临税收和账单带来的 400 英镑冲击
item.description: 决议基金会（Resolution Foundation）智囊团的分析发现，尽管最低工资标准的提高能够抑制通胀，但税收和账单的增加将使典型的英国家庭在下一财政年度的收入减少 400 英镑（约合 517 美元）。【原文：Higher taxes and bills will leave the typical UK household £400 ($517) worse off in the coming fiscal year despite an inflation-busting increase in the minimum wage, analysis by the Resolution Foundation think tank found.】

item.title: 帮助特穆和谢因的关税漏洞将于 5 月 2 日关闭
item.description: 白宫表示，目前允许来自中国和香港的价值高达800美元的包裹免税进入美国的微量关税豁免将于5月2日终止，这对Temu和Shein等折扣市场来说是一个潜在的打击。【原文：De minimis tariff exemptions, which currently allow packages worth as much as $800 from China and Hong Kong to enter the US duty free, will end on May 2, the White House said, a potential blow to discount marketplaces like Temu and Shein.】

item.title: 特朗普关税刺激避险买盘，日元表现优于主要同行
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布加征关税提振避险需求后，日元兑美元在所有主要货币中表现最佳。【原文：The yen is the best performer among all of its major peers against the dollar after President Donald Trump’s tariffs announcement boosted haven demand.】

item.title: 特朗普关税影响金属需求，美国铜价下滑
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对美国在全球的贸易伙伴征收关税，此举标志着他的贸易战大幅升级，周四亚洲早盘纽约铜价下滑。【原文：Copper in New York slid in the Asian morning on Thursday after US President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on US trading partners worldwide, a move that marks a significant escalation in his trade war.】

item.title: 特朗普关税引发全球增长风险，恐惧笼罩市场
item.description: 有那么一瞬间，华尔街对唐纳德-特朗普总统关税计划的最坏担心似乎是多余的，市场开始出现缓解性反弹。【原文：For a brief moment it looked like Wall Street’s worst fears about President Donald Trump’s tariff plans were misplaced — and a relief rally started racing through markets.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布对等关税，对大宗商品影响不一
item.description: 期待已久的唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布对进口美国的商品征收全面的对等关税，这引发了油价暴跌，而黄金上涨。【原文：The long—awaited unveiling by President Donald Trump of sweeping reciprocal tariffs on imports into the US triggered a slump in oil prices while gold rose.】

item.title: 亚洲资产因美国提高关税而受到冲击
item.description: 据策略师称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税大棒首当其冲，亚洲经济体的货币和股票预计将面临抛售压力。【原文：Asian economies bore the brunt of US President Donald Trump’s tariff deluge, with their currencies and stocks expected to come under selling pressure, according to strategists.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布征收关税，日本股市期货下跌，日元升值
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对全球贸易伙伴征收 24% 的关税后，日本股票期货大幅下跌。日元走强也可能拖累出口商股价走低。【原文：Japan’s stock futures slumped after President Donald Trump slapped the nation with a 24% levy as part of tariffs on trading partners worldwide. A stronger yen may also drag exporter shares lower.】
